intro: Siler zernyi subsp. zernyi, commonly known as mountain betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and range in color from pink to purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats.
